messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]slings
messages.msgSnippet: Kathy- I ve heard of and seen the Sling-Ezee but never knew it was deveoped by neighbors of the Sears. Guess they must rub off on people, huh? I have to agree
messages.messageBody:
Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]slings Kathy-
   I've heard of and seen the Sling-Ezee but never knew it was deveoped by neighbors of the Sears. Guess they must rub off on people, huh? I have to agree that the NoJo doesn't fit some people right. I think I'd be happier with something that doesn't require adjustment.

--
Amy Nelson
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99)
"The hardest to learn was the least complicated." - The Indigo Girls

I have always used slings called Sling-Ezee by Parenting Concepts in Lake
Arrowhead, CA.  They look almost identical to the OTSBH, but with a tad less
padding.  I have heard that the NoJo doesn't fit some people right.  The
creators of Sling-Ezee were actually once neighbors to Dr. Sears family until
they moved to the mountains.  They have moms at home making the slings and
you can purchase through a distributor or direct.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]slings
messages.msgSnippet: That s what I had! A Sling-Ezee!  I couldn t remeber what it was called. Trisha ... ________________________________________________________________________
